recipe.ingredients: 1 pound ground chicken, 1 pound chicken sausage, casings removed, 1/4 cup almond flour, 1 large egg, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon onion powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 cups low-sodium marinara sauce
recipe.directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine ground chicken, chicken sausage, almond flour, egg, Parmesan cheese, parsley, minced garlic, dried oregano, onion powder, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly distributed, Roll the mixture into 1-inch meatballs and arrange them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle the meatballs with olive oil, Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the internal temperature of the meatballs reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), While the meatballs are baking, heat the marinara sauce in a large skillet over medium heat, Add the baked meatballs to the sauce and let them simmer for about 5-10 minutes, Serve the chicken sausage meatballs with additional parsley for garnish, if desired.
recipe.nutrition: Calories approx. 330, Total fat 18g, Protein 36g, Cholesterol 140mg, Total carbohydrate 8g, Dietary fiber 2g, Monounsaturated fat 8g, Saturated fat 6g, Added sugars 0g, Sodium 450mg
